heroTitle: A manifesto for specialized, governable agents.
heroLede: Break work into explicit roles, constrain behavior, measure outcomes, and steward change deliberately. This is the operating logic behind every Archon deployment.
philosophyCopy: Intelligence scales better when responsibility is narrow. Clear roles, defined constraints, and measurable outcomes keep systems predictable.
philosophyNote: We resist “one model to rule them all.” Instead, we compose small, auditable roles.
rolesCopy: Each agent owns a role, a boundary, and a handoff. Boundaries prevent scope creep; handoffs keep multi-agent systems legible.
rolesNote: Ownership is codified: inputs accepted, outputs produced, and what to escalate.
lifecycleHeading: Lifecycle: how we design and govern agents
life1Copy: Map the work, risks, and where an agent should own responsibility.
life2Copy: Inputs, outputs, boundaries, and escalation are codified.
life3Copy: Constrain the surface area, measure outcomes, and validate guardrails.
life4Copy: Connect to data and tools with logging, alerts, and audit trails.
life5Copy: Run evaluations, regression suites, and human-in-the-loop checks.
life6Copy: Track drift, version changes, and retire or expand roles deliberately.
component1Copy: Responsibilities, inputs, outputs, and exclusions are explicit before an agent is deployed.
component2Copy: Constraints, escalation paths, and stop conditions so agents remain safe in production.
component3Copy: Metrics, checklists, and scoring logic to verify the agent is delivering the intended outcome.
component4Copy: Data access, tools, and system touchpoints mapped with observability for audits.
component5Copy: Pilots with small surfaces, followed by structured expansion once reliability is demonstrated.
component6Copy: Versioned prompts, regression suites, and rollback steps so updates are deliberate.
governanceCopy: Make systems transparent and governable. Reduce risk when deploying AI into real workflows by keeping audit trails and clear ownership.
governanceNote: Compliance teams know what was decided, by which agent, and under which constraints.
governAudit: Structured logs of prompts, tool calls, and outcomes.
governEvaluate: Checklists for correctness, safety, and adherence to role boundaries.
governEscalate: Defined human-in-the-loop triggers and failover paths.
